Reviews.Title: “Try the suite overlooking the canal.”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoIrene
Reviews.Content: Our assigned room for the first of the three nights in the San Sebastiano Garden Hotel was a disapointment. It was too small without a view. However, we agreed to upgrade and pay more and move to a much larger room with a balcony overlooking the canal with a great view of the San Sebastiano Church across the canal. I would call our new room a suite, see photos. The room was quite spacious with lovely appointments which helped carry you back to earlier centuries of Venice. The hotel is small but charming. The only meal available to my knowledge is a continental breakfast and since the weather was so nice we ate outside in the rear garden. The garden is very private for the guests. It takes about 3 or 4 minutes to walk to the water taxi pick up point and there are several restaurants within a one minute walk of the hotel. Our room was quiet and we controlled our air conditioning. Their are two adjoining bathrooms within the suite and one has a large bath tub and the other has a shower. There is no toilet in the bath room with the bath tub/sink; but in the other bathroom with the shower, there is a toilet and bidet, and sink. I loved the large wood table in the room - lots of space to organize your suitcases. There is also a desk next to the fireplace. The bed consisted of two twin beds pushed together. There is no mini bar or safe. It was fun to walk out on the balcony and watch the boats go by on the canal. The staff were helpful and courteous. The hotel helped us to have a very lovely time in Venice. The large old church across from the hotel was closed for construction, but hopefully it will be open by the time you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful "almost secret" in my favourite area of venice”
Reviews.Author: waterbird62
Reviews.Content: a historical residence with a wonderful garden , conveniently located but at the same time tucked away from the main stream of tourist hordes which often (or in high season) almost always converge on this most magic city of cites. we have stayed here several times over the winter, and where always fortunate to have a very attractive furnished room and comfortable spacious bathrooms. Our bathrooms were not only elegant but huge ( one almost as big as some rooms in venice) well kept, even if a bit dated. Being a historical residence the reality and charm is ofcourse that the rooms vary in size and appearance. The decorating styles of the hotel do have a melange of styles and periods and tastes. Each time that we stayed here, our time spent in venice was enhanced not only by the comfort of our stay and very attractive enviornment, but in particular by the dedicated and very professional and kind staff at both the reception and breakfast area which added special warmth and a special personal touch to all our stays. we travel often for both work and pleasure and in general i am very dubious of any restaurant recomendations given by a hotel reception, but being familiar with venice and the area I was curious as to what they would reccomend in the area. When in the suggestions was included one of our recent favourites, my ears perked up and so we decided to try one located closeby which we didn't know and hadn't heard of: "osteria ai 4 feri". I had asked for a ristorant suggestion based on "simple,casual, local and very correct price/quality"... we had a wonderful lunch and went back for dinner the next day ... it fit the description more than perfectly plus the ingredients are really fresh and menu is mainly dictacted from the daily market and season. If you are looking for a hotel that is convenient , but tucked in an area where locals& students still manage to outnumber the tourists all year round, but still is only less than a 10 min walk to ponte accademia or a 3-5min walk to the nearest vaporetto stop and a wonderful 30 min walk to san marco or rialto with a warm and very dedicated staff..PLUS the hidden treasure of a beautiful garden to relax or start the day when the weather is nice...than we can only reccomend and hope that you are lucky enough to get a room...we've been here in offseason and so the rapport of price quality was also really excellent! We hope to be back soon to this charming hideaway and magic venice!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent. Baby fiendly”
Reviews.Author: Natalia M
Reviews.Content: Good location â€“ only 20 minutes walking to SanMarco square. We were staying with a 8-month baby: baby-bed were already waiting us when we stepped in. Some small things can be improved: shampoo was given only once, so I had to ask desk manager to give me more, on the next day I had bought bottle of my own.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ecimken
Reviews.Content: We (my mom and I) stayed at San Sebastiano this past October. I had been to Venice before but my mom had not. I wanted to experience the authentic side of venice while still being close to all of the top sights. This hotel was perfect. The staff were very helpful and sweet. Breakfast was wonderful and we even had a few meals in the garden which was just lovely. The neighborhood is filled with wonderful restaurants , great little shops, a market, water bus stop, churches, etc. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decor, staff - but should be 3 star, not 4.”
Reviews.Author: KKWWestSussex
Reviews.Content: Our trip was to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary and we stayed for 5 nights at the beginning of November. We'd asked for a room overlooking the canal - room 21 on the first floor - nicely furnished, if a little small. The bed was rather hard for our taste so our sleep quality wasn't great, but that might have suited others so not really a criticism. The only criticism on the room was that they advertise satellite TV with international channels but the only English channel was CNN. We had hoped to watch the odd late film but that wasn't possible. Breakfast was fine - typical continental - and the staff very friendly and attentive. We had a quick look at the garden on our first morning. It did look a bit neglected but could imagine it being lovely in the summer and a real bonus in Venice. The main reasons I think the Hotel should only be 3 star is that it has only a very small lounge/bar area in the reception area so very limited space to relax in if you don't want to be confined to your room after a long day sightseeing (though of course in the summer there is the garden), and there is no restaurant, just a breakfast room, so facilities are limited. This is a great time of year to visit Venice. We were really lucky with the weather, bright sunny days and not too crowded. We walked miles through all 6 'sestieri', booked the 'Venice in a Day' tour - 4 parts, but actually spread them over 2 days - gondola ride, motor launch trip along the Grand Canal with lovely American guide who explained Venice's fascinating history and architecture, and guided tours of both the Bascilica and the Doges Palace. We took the Vaporetti over to San Giorgio - amazing church and best view of Venice from the top of the bell tower. We went to a Vivaldi Concert in San Vidal, the Accademie, the Museo Correr in Piazza San Marco. We found a restaurant quite close to the hotel that had such a fantastic menu that we went back 2 more times (their seafood was incredible, especially paella that was well worth the half hour wait while it was cooked fresh - and the 30 Euros each for the dish!!). We had a ball! I would certainly recommend the San Sebastiano Garden Hotel to friends - as others have said, it was nice to come back to in the evening. One tip worth mentioning. To get to the Hotel on arrival we took the Alilaguna boat (turn left immediately out of the airport and walk 10 minutes along canopied path to the ferry - buy your ticket in the airport before coming out - 15 Euros), but it took over an hour and was dark by the time we got there, taking the magic out of arriving in Venice from the sea. The day we were leaving we simply walked the 10 minutes or so to Piazza Roma and took the bus - only 5 Euros - back to the airport. That way meant crossing about 5 bridges so only really suitable if you've smallish suitcases on wheels. All in all, a great trip. Expensive, but worth it because there simply is nowhere else in the world like it.

Reviews.Title: “"Lovely hotel away from the tourist area"”
Reviews.Author: embcn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was like a little palace with its own charms and a nice garden in the back perhaps to sit and enjoy reading a book; it was about 10 minutes of pleasant walk to the crowded tourist districts (San Marcos). The staff provided an excellent service, always very helpful with pleasantry. The room was small but cozy:-) the bathroom has a big bath tub. Breakfast was complete with all the essential food groups to start the day. It was not quite expensive but could be cheaper; but of course, it is the one and only Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in a nice part of venice”
Reviews.Author: holodan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 or 4 nights. We loved our time in Venice and this hotel was mostly part of the nice experience. The staff were friendly and even though our reservation (from Hotels.com) said check-in time wasn't until 2 pm we we checked in at around 1 pm without any problem. All the desk clerks were very helpful and friendly with directions or any help they could give and all spoke good English, which was good for us since we attempted to speak some rudimentary Italian, but wouldn't be able to get very far with it. We had a room near the elevator on the top floor that had a nice balcony that overlooked the garden in the middle of all the houses. The bed was not exactly super-fluffy luxurious like in the high-end US hotels, but it was just fine. I find I sleep just fine as long as the bed is not too hard. One day we were incredibly tired from our travel schedule and slept through breakfast and everything was already cleared away, but Maria was very kind to give us some food and even make us espresso, even though we were hesitant since it was our own fault for missing the meal time. The bathroom had a comically narrow toilet and bidet, but it all worked out just fine. We absolutely loved this location near the south side of the island since it was close enough to many things to do and wasn't too much of a bother to get anywhere, yet it was far enough away from both the train station and Piazza San Marco that we weren't inundated with the bustle of the area around the train station or the relentless annoying herds of tourists all the time. It was probably only a 15 or 20 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. The southern promenade near the hotel also was enjoyable to walk along and it was very close to a Vaporetto stop. There is a grocery store along the promenade around the corner from the hotel and a lively neighborhood with interesting nightlife and places to eat north (or maybe north north east) about 5 or 10 minutes walk. The price for this hotel was very reasonable for Venice compared to things I saw online in other nice neighborhoods there. We were there over part of the holiday weekend before May day and it was hard to find reasonably priced rooms, but the price and the experience were both mostly good. The only bad part of the hotel was the typical European habit of never, ever believing in screens on the windows. You really don't find them anywhere and in Venice it's extra bad because there are mosquitoes that are waiting to drink your blood if you leave the window open, even for a few minutes to cool off. This was a problem because the hotel was not running any kind of air conditioning. It's totally understandable not to run it since the day wasn't too hot and the evenings were pleasantly cool outside. However, this is a big problem with a room with no air circulation on the top floor and all the heat rising. Without the windows open, it was ridiculously hot and stuffy; and with them opened enough to cool off, we were dive-bombed by mosquitoes all night and woke up with a number of itchy mosquito bite welts. Not a very pleasant choice: either roast to death from the heat and not sleep or have mosquitoes buzz by your ears and bite you and wake you up. I'm sure the situation would be different at a time of year when the air conditioning was on, but the hotel either needs to provide some kind of screen to allow people to cool off without the mosquitoes getting in or circulate some kind of cooler air, even if it's just cool outside air run through the air conditioning system. (We tried running air but it just blew hot air which made things worse.)

Reviews.Title: “Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Upalia
Reviews.Content: Lovely location a bit off the beaten track of the Grand Canal, but worth views of the Lagoon and the restaraunt just along the canal towards the Lagoon. Rooms were the smallest in our tour of Italy but had a nice balcony overlooking the garden as redemption for size of room. The Staff on the first day were great could not do enough then went down hill considerably till we left as an after thought they happened to mention general strike and trains might be effecte d. No water Taxis so carry case to Train station not amusing as lots of bridges . Venice try the alleyways you will find some treasures shops and restaraunts , Bridge of Sighs is how it came across in my history lessons Rialato was disappointing to commericial, but everyone has to make money... Great place to stroll............

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet reviews/expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel from the reviews we read on TripAdvisor, however after 2 nights at this hotel we would not recommend it. We booked 2 rooms for 4 people (two couples) on Orbitz. The reservation indicated that check in was at 12:00 pm. However when we arrived at around 12:35 pm, the woman at the front desk informed me that check in was not until "2 or 3" and that Orbitz was wrong and a check in at 12:30 was impossible. Very curt and that was the answer, no offer to take my luggage or offer up the lobby restroom. Once I asked if them keeping our luggage was an option, she did agree. So we went to see some sights and eat lunch. When we got back to the hotel at 3:30 (just in case) we may have been the 2 worst rooms in the hotel. Rooms 10 and 11. Room 10 is the first room to the left when walking into the hotel within the lobby. Room 11 is the door in between the staff lobby restroom and the guest lobby restroom. Room 10, the air conditioning was lacking and was full of cob webbs and mosquitoes. Room 11 was just noisy from being mistaken for being the lobby restroom. Both rooms, the shampoo and bath gels provided were open and used, there were dead mosquito smudges all over the walls and ceiling, and the plaster in the bathrooms was moldy and falling down. Lastly upon check out we needed to pay the city tax in cash, not credit card, which was never communicated to us prior to check out. Luckily we had reserved just enough euros to pay for it with getting back to the airport to return home. While the continental breakfast included was minimal, the breakfast waitress was very nice. If we return to Venice, we will definitely take our chances on another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel made even better by incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: davidpryan
Reviews.Content: Highlights were cozy, clean rooms, extremely helpful staff, great breakfast, and the somewhat secluded location (everything in Venice seems to be within 30 minutes walking distance; but only 3 minutes to a vaporetto stop). Can't say enough about how helpful the staff was!

Reviews.Title: “No A/C, awful bed and carpet, nice garden, very near San Basilio cruise terminal”
Reviews.Author: NextStopAsia
Reviews.Content: Picked it because it was close by vaporetto from train station (Santa Lucia/Piazzale Roma) to hotel, and walking distance to Windstar cruise terminal. They had free internet! Furnishings not great, bed uncomfortable, carpet nasty, air conditioning didn't work in August, no water pressure. Asked to be moved to room with functioning A/C but they would charge me more for bigger room with ugly furnishings where A/C didn't work either, but at least on lower floor so cooler. Breakfast sad but made effort to clean up secret garden in the back with nice enough furnishings and fountain. They did offer me a bottle of Prosecco on checkout! Interesting neighborhood and very convenient to get on cruise ship. Nice walk up to St. Mark's over Accademia bridge, then took vaporetto up grand canal and around to San Basilio, had lunch in a trattoria, and walked luggage over to ship (warning: stairs just outside cruise terminal, and between train station and initial vaporetto--random strangers will help with luggage!).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for our wedding”
Reviews.Author: Bruntdog8
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 3 day stay in Venice, during which we stayed at the Hotel San Sebastiano. This was not just your normal 3 day break, we actually got married in Venice and had the ceremony in the garden of the hotel. We had visited Venice in November 2010 to look for potential venues for our wedding and came across the hotel by accident. Itâ€™s in the Dorsoduro area and not located in the centre of the main tourist spots but youâ€™re only a 10 minute walk to the Piazzale Roma and the closest waterbus stop is only 2 mins away. There is also a supermarket only 2 mins away which was great as you could stock up on food and drink without having to pay all the jumped up prices you find by San Marco Sq and other attractions. We exchanged emails with the manager over the next few months and returned to Venice in March 2011 to have a meeting with the manager to make the necessary arrangements for the wedding. Once everything had been agreed, we continued to have regular communication with the hotel to make sure everything was going to plan. The manager was always very prompt to reply to any questions we had and there were no issues with regards to the language difference as her English was very good. On arrival at the hotel the manager had arranged for our party to be served some Prosecco, a selection of meat and chesses which was lovely. We had arrived before the usual check in time but they were able to get our room ready so that the rest of the guests could put there bags in there and freshen up. The hotel itself was immaculate with a good mix of traditional and modern Venetian design. During our stay there the hotel staff could not do enough for us and were great on the day of the wedding. They closed off the garden in the morning and set up all the chairs and tables and added a few nice little decorative touches to give it more of a wedding feel. The hotel had never held a wedding ceremony in the garden before so everything was a bit of a learning curve, but everything went to plan and it really was an amazing day. We held the ceremony in the garden and then left for the restaurant. We arrived back at the hotel around 9.30pm and the staff had arranged for some speakers to be set up in the garden and cleared an area for our guests to have a dance floor. We could only stay outside until midnight but then moved into the bar area where we stayed until the early hours and even got the night staff to join in on the dance floor! All in all the day could not have gone better. The hotel has 3 types of rooms; classic, deluxe and junior suite. We had one of the junior suites during our stay and it was huge!! A king size bed and also a jacuzzi bath which was great to relax in after a busy day walking around Venice. The room was very clean and without doubt one of the grandest rooms we have every stayed in on our travels. Our guests stayed in various classic and deluxe rooms, and they again were very clean and a mixture of classic venetian and modern design. The pick of the deluxe rooms would be the one located on the top floor with the four poster bed and a great view out into the garden. Breakfast was great. There was a good selection of fresh pastries, cereal, fruit, bread, cheese and also freshly sliced parma ham on request. One of the staff also baked fresh cakes on a daily basis and they were out of this world. The hotel also had a computer in the reception area which you could use to get on the internet and also offered free WI FI for guests. All in all and I speak for our entire wedding party, we would highly recommend Hotel San Sebastiano Garden to anyone who plans to visit Venice. We had a bit of apprehension when we decided to arrange our wedding abroad, especially without the use of a wedding planner, but it could not have gone any better. We would like to thank the hotel and its staff for helping make our wedding the amazing 3 day event it was and we will definitely be returning there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: engineer77
Reviews.Content: I particularly liked the location of this hotel - away from the crowds of San Marco and Rialto but close to the San Basilio vaporetto stop in Dorsoduro so everything you want to visit can be easily reached. Campo Santa Margherita is only a short walk with lots of outdoor cafes open until late. The rooms were clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. Breakfast was also good. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. All in all a very nice stay. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Hotel - Beautiful Garden”
Reviews.Author: jpatrickfamily
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a large room overlooking the canal for 3-nights. The room had nice historic detail and a renovated bathroom. The rear garden was a great gathering spot for our group. We appreciated the location away from the crowds of St. Marks square, but close enough to walk to all the attactions.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil oasis, off centre location, not quite four star”
Reviews.Author: dublintraveller100
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three night stay in the San Sebastiano Garden, a tanqui oasis at the E end of Dorsoduro, near to the Basilio vaporetto stop and to a district where â€˜ordinaryâ€™ Venetians live. The Piazzale Roma is less than ten minutes on foot. The property is small, more a pensione than an hotel. There is a canal in front and a pleasant garden at the back, an untypical luxury in Venice. Water taxis can stop outside the entrance. The dÃ©cor is unfussy classic. Our â€˜superiorâ€™ room looked across the canal to the eponymous church, which is worth a visit. (Most rooms donâ€™t have this view). The bedroom was well sized and adequately equipped - apart from a fuzzy TV - but the bathroom was small and had poor storage. Breakfast, is a simple cold 3 * buffet - which can be taken to the garden, weather permitting. No other meals are offered but there are plenty of restaurants nearby. There is free internet access, wired in the bedrooms, WiFi in the lobby. The (few) staff were generally pleasant and helpful. This is not a luxe hotel or a destination and the location may be too peripheral for first time visitors. But we think the San Sebastiano competes well on a value-for-money basis with the other six hotels we have used in Venice,. Rcommended, especially to self-sufficient and return Venetian visitors who value simplicity and a peaceful location. Tip â€“ the nearby Avogaria restaurant offers good Puglian inspired cuisine in a pleasant courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service & Bad Attitude”
Reviews.Author: jcalo77
Reviews.Content: I am just finishing a 3-night stay at the San Sebastiano. While I like the location of the hotel, the attitude and service of the staff is VERY POOR! When I arrived I found urine stains on my bathroom floor and was placed in a handicapped equiped room on the first floor. When I spoke to management about this their response was I will make a note of it. The urine was never cleaned off the bathroom floor. Very disgusting and unsanitary. On my last day upon return to the hotel from sightseeing I returned to my room which was left unlocked/door wide open. The staff at the desk said that is was no big deal and its not their responsibility if I leave valuables in the room. Who lets housekeeping leave rooms unlocked and on the first floor!!!!!???? When I asked to speak with someone about the entire situation I was basically told I had to deal with it as the boss was in Milan. They have done nothing to try and rectify the situation or provide good customer service. This would never happen in a hotel where I am from. If you stay here beware of the poor service and potential for a gross room. FYI, there are dead mosquitoes smeared all over the room walls too.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location, nice hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: emma40
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel in the Dorsoduro area, located on the south-western side of town. It is just a 2 minute walk from the Vaparetto (water-bus) stop, either S. Basilio or Zattere, very easy to get to from the Airport. We chose to have a regular/classic double room. The room was on the top floor, quite small, white walls and ceiling (with really old wooden beams), mini-bar and a in-room safe. It was nice and clean with a good sized bathroom. In addition to the usual toiletries they also had intimate soap, cotton pads and q-tips in the bathroom, just a little extra I appreciate. One thing I must comment is that it was very warm in the room, and I am sure it will be very hot up there during the summer months if the air-condition do not work properly. It was okay now and you can open the window because it is a very quiet area. The breakfast, which is included, was nice with homemade rolls, pastry, cereals, yoghurt, cheese, ham, boiled egg, jam and fruits. And as everywhere in Italy â€“ the coffee is really good, you just name it and they make it to you: Cappuccino, Latte, Americano, Espressoâ€¦.etc. The staff are very nice and helpful as well, so I will absolutely stay here next time I go to Venice! This is an area with lots of students and it has lots of nice bars and osteries and trattoires, maybe the only area in Venice you will be positive surprised when you get your bar bill. You also have lots of attractions within walking distance â€“ so put on your walking shoes and get yourself lost in the labyrinth of narrow alleys, take a glass of wine or a bite in â€œa hole in the wallâ€� or sit down at a small Campo. Stay away from the huge touristic areas and eat where the locals eats â€“ do try the seafood, it is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Great”
Reviews.Author: Flamenco_Sun
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the great Trip Advisor reviews, and because my previous visits to Venice had highlighted this as a good area to stay in. For anyone who has been to Venice before and wants to get away from the crowds of S.Marco, this is an ideal base to work from. As all the other reviews point out, the hotel is close enough to the bus station and vaparetto stop to make getting around the city pretty easy. It also has restaurants, tabacchi, shops and even a supermarket close by. For a more lively scene in the evening, there's lots of life in Campo S.Margerita, 5-8 mins walk away. The hotel has a lovely tranquil garden too. We were lucky enough to have room 14 on the ground floor, which has hand-painted frescoes on the wall, and overlooks this garden. So far, so good. So what stops me giving the hotel an excellent / outstanding view? A few things weren't quite right about our stay. Firstly, we were givehttps://tonic.tripadvisor.com/img2/x.gifn a very mediochre room. It didn't seem like the deluxe double that I had pre-paid for, and lo and behold, it wasn't. When challenged, Reception admitted they had made a mistake. But I still couldn't say whether the 'mistake' was genuine or not. Then the air conditioning wouldn't work. Reception weren't especially concerned about it, and it never got fixed. For a very hot week, it wasn't comfortable having air-con that only produced heat. This meant leaving a window open (not great on the ground floor), getting mosquito bites, and getting woken up on the hour every hour by a church bell. Next up, breakfast is advertised as starting at 7:30am. On our first morning, they were nowhere near ready to actually serve anyone at that time. The breakfast is adequate, but more 3* than 4* standard. Another day there was no bath towels. The TV is bizarre too... 200+ channels with less than 10 that actually work (but you still have to scroll through them). There's also no hotel information in the rooms. OK... that's enough moaning. Despite all these niggles, this is a TOP hotel. The staff were friendly, and the room was almost a work of art. They just need to have a look at some of the finer detail. But seriously - don't let me put you off! You will fall in love with the area around the hotel. I'm pretty sure I'd go back oneday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed rooms, really friendly staff, very nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Hindsight_CA
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet residential area - easy walk coming from the airport water bus - home made goodies at breakfast and freshly carved (I watched her do it) parma ham (yum!) Free computer and internet access. The hotel combines the old and new beautifully, our room was comfortable, and the bathroom was big. The staff was personable and helpful, the garden is a great escape after a long day on your feet. I would make a point to stay there again if I'm lucky enough to find myself in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Lulu1967
Reviews.Content: Excellent location beside canal and a lovely garden. Extremely friendly, cheerful staff who were generous with their time and advice. Great breakfast of fruit, yoghurt, breads, ham, cheese and eggs with delicious homemade cakes and tarts. Very clean, spacious room. Easy to reach by taking vaporetto water taxi on left hand side as you exit train station - Line 2 to San Basilio stop then minutes to walk, straight ahead as you disembark. Beautiful setting and within very easy walking distance of art galleries. Supermarket close to vaparetto stop and restaurants close by. Really worthwhile buying a three day vaporetto pass which you can book online and then exchange the printed receipt for a ticket at the ticket office outside the station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, good location, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cottonali
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at San Sebastiano Garden Hotel based on the reviews from TripAdvisor. We too were pleased with the overall cleanliness and appearance of the hotel. I agree, the staff (especially the male night manager) were very friendly and extremely helpful. The location is good: 3 minute walk to the Vaporetto stop, 10 minutes to Gallerie Del'Academia and about 20-30 minutes walk to San Marco piazza. I agree with other reviews that there is not much to see around the hotel itself: its quiet but still idilic, and there aren't many restaurants right on the doorstep. But nowhere takes long to walk to in Venice - we found a brilliant restaurant only 10 minutes away. The breakfast buffet is as others have described, typical for Italian hotels: cereals, pastries, breads, cheese, ham, cappuccino. We had a lovely ground floor room, sadly it looked onto a courtyard (not very exciting) rather than the canal. It was small but in no ways cramped - ample room and storage for our belongings. The bed however was the biggest bed I have every seen! The bathroom was very nice, but it was equipped for disabled visitors, so the toilet had a rather bizarre 'booster seat' on it, and lots of handles and plastic aids everywhere. Whilst this is obviously good for disabled people, it sort of spoiled the asthetic for us. There was a large long garden with a terrace with tables and chairs, which was nice. However it was a bit chilly for us to sit out in the garden long. I imagine it would be very beautiful in the summer with a bit more greenery. We drank our morning coffee on the terrace in the sunshine, which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean hotel, in a good location”
Reviews.Author: tofurker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Sebastiano Garden Hotel based on the reviews from TripAdvisor. We were pleased with the overall cleanliness and appearance of the hotel. The staff (especially the male night manager) were very friendly and welcoming whenever we had questions. The location is good: 3 minute walk to the boat-bus, and about 20-30 minutes walk to St. Mark's area. There is not much to see around the hotel itself: very few restaurants, so you need to eat elsewhere before returning to your room at night. The breakfast buffet was typical for hotels in Italy: cereals, breads, cheese, ham, cappuccino. The rooms were somewhat disappointing compared with others we had stayed at on the trip: very small and cramped. There was a balcony, which was nice, however it was February so we didn't go out much. The bathroom was clean, but of course, tiny, and had a really strange shaped toilet: very high and narrow (like a rectangle!) which was not very comfortable. Overall, for the price this is a very good place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Great Location Great staff”
Reviews.Author: barcaranger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quiet and has great service. The staff are super helpful. I had a deluxe room which was worth the extra Â£50 over three nights. It's a great location along a quiet hotel. Lovely for a romantic getaway. One tiny criticism breakfast was a tiny bit spartan

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel for antiques lovers, romantic place, but a little bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Cats_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on our honeymoon and San Sebastiano was exactly what we expected in Venice for the special romantic experience. The girl in the reception was very helpful and smiling. The atmosphere at the hotel is prestigious. Our room was spacious with antique furniture. If you're ready to pay extra money for the special atmosphere it will be a good choise for you. The atmosphere at the hotel is prestigious. Our room was spacious with antique furniture. The hotel is located in the romantic place of Venice, on the chanel and near the water bus station, but it will take ~20 min. to get to the center by walk. If you're ready to pay extra money for the special atmosphere it will be a good choise for you in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: Hullnotdull
Reviews.Content: This was a small elegant hotel with a garden to eat breakfast in, the room was lovely, and we loved the location, using the water buses to get every where. The marble floors and antique furniture helped the relaxed atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Nice, boutique hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: steveskinchicago
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the San Sebastiano hotel in Venice. The hotel was very clean with interesting decor. Our room was small, but adequate. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. We really liked the location in the Dorsadoro section of Venice, quiet and residential, away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel in a quiet non-touristy area, right by a canal”
Reviews.Author: 5474C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights, and left our cases for the fifth day before catching the overnight train. All the reception staff were really helpful, the first giving us lots of restaurant recommendations which we took up. We think we made the right choice to stay in Dorsoduro, a quiet area south of the centre, but right next to the waterfront. It felt like 'real' Venice, with water taxis popping back and forth on the small,canal right outside our breakfast room window. The hotel has a lovely garden, but sadly the weather wasn't quite good enough to eat outside. Though it's in the south of venice, it took only half an hour (with a decent map) to walk with our cases from the station. It is very near the Accademia art gallery and the Guggenheim, and the Accademia bridge gives quick access to the main centre.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel really does refect the timeless luxury of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Supergrannieisgreat
Reviews.Content: The friendly welcoming staff helped in every way they could and certainly understood the concept of good service. We were so pleased with the beautiful hotel and our lovely room that we booked a seceond night and the staff rearranged new arrivals to enable us to stay in the same room. The decor of the hotel was of an extremely high standard throughout and this made it a very pleasant and relaxing place to 'come home' to after a day of being stunned by Venice in all it its glory.When we return to Venice for a longer stay this is the hotel we will choose.

Reviews.Title: “We've been to venice 5 times, and this would be the hotel I would go back to.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMegs
Reviews.Content: We were so glad to find this amazing spot. We had a big beautiful room on the top floor overlooking the garden. The people at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful. The garden in the back is definetly the place to sit and watch your kids play while you enjoy breakfast. This is great hotel walking distance/short boat trip from all the sites, but avoids all the crowds and lets you experience the nontouristy part of venice (that's an oxymoron probably :) We've been to venice 5 times, and this would be the hotel I would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest people we encountered at any hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: katie237
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was awesome. They gave us recommendations for restaurants, really good directions, and were overall extremely helpful and sincere. We got an upgraded room for no reason with a gorgeous garden view. Breakfast in the garden was tranquil. No noisy streets or people at this hotel. It was far enough off of the beaten path to avoid the swarm of tourists, with a 10-15 min leisurely walk to St Mark's. Getting to the hotel was easy, either from the People Mover or the Vaporetto. If you stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dickyhc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of May and couldn't fault any aspect. The bedroom was immaculate, overlooking the garden. A well furnished, delightful boutique hotel. Service excellent , friendly and informative - the staff gave useful tips about good restaurants, vaporetto and highlights of Venice. Breakfasted in the garden both mornings in a lovely setting. Easy access to very good restaurants - average bill for lunch for in the Dorsoduro district around 50-60 euros for 2. Gondola 80 euros for 35/40 minutes before 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very special!”
Reviews.Author: sognino
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and I'm looking forward to stay there again and even though it's a little bit too expensive I still strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at San Sebastiano”
Reviews.Author: rob091
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel. Our room was much smaller this time and the hot water was touch and go, our room last trip was really good. Apart from that the room was fine. The location is great, opposite San Sebastiano; San Raffaele and a short walk to the San Basilio vaparetti station. There are lot's of great walks in the area and the walk to San Marco via the Accademia bridge is very pleaseant. The staff are very helpful, the breakfast is great. They also have a very nice garden at the back which would be a great place for a cool glass of Prosecco on a warm evening.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet discreet palace with a lot of class”
Reviews.Author: duke02
Reviews.Content: I got a deluxe room, very confortable , well furnished and with a big bathroom that I think is very important. This family palace converted in hotel blends in the Venetian atmosphere and makes the guest experience the magic of Venice even in the hotel room. Talk to the owner whose family has been living in Venice for more than 400 years for tips to the best restaurants where you eat wonderfully without being ripped off

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CateA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in this beautiful hotel facing the water on one side and a pretty garden on the back. Our room overlooked the garden and was huge buy felt like it could have down with a few nice soft furnishings as the lack of stuff made the vast room look a bit sparse. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel located in the Dorsoduro area of Venice which is nice and quiet and has I think personally the nicest selection of restaurants. Breakfast was good and service friendly. All the must see things are within a walkable distance as is anywhere in Venice if you don't mind getting a bit lost now and again but I would recommend an ACTV pass which worked out good value when you consider the boat transfer to and from the mainland is 6.50 Euros each to begin with. San Marco is only two stops away from the hotel and also a trip out the the Lido to see the beach is worth a visit! The only thing that I didn't like is all the tourists which I don't suppose you can do much about in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: VFTL
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much our staying at San Sebastiano Garden Hotel. We booked de luxe room but the receptionist upgraded us to the canal view junior suite that was beautiful. The hotel is a really distinguished and friendly one. Elegant and spacious rooms are decorated with antique furniture mixed with modern design (de Majo lamps), very recently renovated. It's a bit out of the center in Dorsoduro, but there is a vaporetto station right there as well as shopping (Billa) and several restaurants in this area. We recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: cembc99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the San Sebastiano Hotel this past June. Overall the hotel was very nice. Our room was a good size and there was free wifi in the lobby. Before booking this hotel, my biggest concern was distance from the sights in Venice. It looked far on the map, but it really isn't. It was about a 15-20 min walk to San Marco, and it is a nice walk because it is down a canal and through the old, narrow streets. Lots of charm. There is also a Vaparetto stop close by, so it is easy to get around. There are a lot of restaurants and shops nearby, so there is plenty to do. And, it is nice to stay away from the crowds at San Marco. The staff were very friendly. They provided us with maps and directions. My only complaint about this hotel, was that when we asked for directions to Murano, they told us that they have a free water taxi service to Murano. What they did not tell us (and maybe we were too naive and should have understood nothing in this world is free) is that they have some sort of deal with a glassblowing factory. So, when you get there they usher you into a demonstration (which was interesting) but then they forced you through a showroom of ridiculously expensive glass items and pressured you to buy. Most of the things in the showroom were more than we had spent on our trip, so it was really awkward. And then, the return taxi back did not take us anywhere near our hotel. They dropped us off very far from anything and it took us an hour to find our way back to something familiar. I just really wish the hotel had been honest about this. We would have taken the Vaporretto had we known what they were about.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Sebastiano Garden - An Elegant Corner of Venice - with a Garden!”
Reviews.Author: pbreddaway
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in this quiet, elegant hotel in June 2009. We recommend it highly - for its 4-star comfort, its tasteful interior design, its peaceful location, and - a rarity in Venice - its spacious garden with lawns, trees, benches, antique statues, and pools. It also has easy access to restaurants and shops, and to vaporetto stops on both the Grand Canal and the Giudecca channel. In addition, we found the service to be pleasant and efficient. Peter Reddaway, McLean, Virginia, USA

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a wonderful garden”
Reviews.Author: Moya97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Sebastiano for 3 nights and enjoyed the stay. We were pleased with the location, since we were a little ways out from the main attractions. The nights were peaceful and quiet and the garden was great for breakfast and just getting some quiet time. The room was a very good size for Venice and the staff were more than helpful on each occasion that we asked for help. The hotel is a 4-5 minute walk to the nearest vaparetto. This made it easy to get on and off all the different stops in Venice, Burano, and Murano. Little tip...get the 2-3 day vaparetto pass depending on how long you plan on staying....Cheaper! Now back to the hotel. This hotel was an all around delight to stay at. We were happy with most everything there. Oops, one other tip, don't get room 34-NO VIEW PERIOD! Good place to stay and not to far from all the attractions by water bus.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than I could have imagined.................”
Reviews.Author: giantpringle
Reviews.Content: Really lovely Hotel on a small side canal, helpful and friendly staff .................... very lovely rooms, ours overlooked the canal and was really well done. A very high quality hotel and certainly not the normal Venice rip-off. If we return to Venice we'll definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: cLangslet
Reviews.Content: We will definitely add this hotel to our global short list of properties to go back to and recommend. The location was wonderful! Quiet, engaging local atmosphere with Venetian style and ambiance. The added lovely garden was a great location for an afternoon tea and rest. The hotel is well maintained and we were pleasantly surprised at the value, location and service. C Langslet

Reviews.Title: “Expensive But Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: mqp2874
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4-star hotel. Our room was OK -- but nothing special. It was very, very small with a heavily stained carpet. (The photos featured on the hotel's Web site and here on Tripadvisor are "deluxe" rooms -- ours was a standard double.) The bed was extremely uncomfortable -- you could feel the mattress springs poking into your back and sides. But, it was the bathroom that was the worst part. We were very surprised to find a dirty, moldy shower curtain. (When I complained about the shower curtain and asked if it could be replaced -- yes, it was THAT nasty! -- I was told the curtain is plastic and that it's normal for it to get dirty! In short, no -- they would not replace it.) Also, there was blood on the floor. Apparently, the cleaning staff wasn't as thorough as it should have been. These are things you would expect from a 2-star hotel. Not a hotel that costs more than 300 Euros (or $400) a night. On the plus side, the hotel garden IS beautiful. The complimentary buffet-style breakfast is good -- lots to choose from, and you can eat it outside. The service is decent for Venetian standards, and the air-conditioning works. The hotel is also located away from the main, tourist-trap areas so it's quiet and a good place to return to after a long day of sight-seeing and pushing through the crowds. Venice is an expensive city. This hotel is expensive for what it offers. I would not stay here again, but it is not the worst place in the world. A 4-star hotel in Venice is not what a 4-star hotel in another city would be. Venice is beautiful and the tourists will come no matter what, so -- it seems -- they don't have to try as hard. Still... next time, we'll be staying someplace else. A few other points about the hotel: -- there is a computer available on the ground floor, but you have to pay to use it -- the hotel is located close to the San Sebastiano vaporetto stop, so transfer to and from the airport is not difficult -- the hotel has an arrangement with a glass-making factory in Murano; you get a free boat taxi ride to Murano, but then have to sit through a demo and walk through the glass company's warehouse. (You feel a lot of pressure to buy something. We would not have gone had we known ahead of time that it was a "trap.") You're on your own for the trip back FROM Murano, though -- so beware

Reviews.Title: “The Secret Garden of Venice”
Reviews.Author: zen1
Reviews.Content: After a fabulous but tiring day discovering Venice, where better to return to than the San Sebastiano with its oasis of peace and tranquility. Definitely Venice's best kept secret. The area is quiet, yet close to everything and behind this simple, yet elegant hotel is its wonderful garden. Perfect for late morning coffee or early evening drinks, it was the best antidote to the busy Venetian streets. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and the rooms evoked the days of Venice gone by with their elegant history. A complete joy!

Reviews.Title: “A fantasitc chic boutique hotel in Venice with a haven of a garden.”
Reviews.Author: UK109
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, with refreshingly modern yet romantic rooms, in a quiet spot on the canal, with a beautiful Venetian garden to relax and have coffee in amidst the Jasmine and Wisteria in the sunshine, just heavenly. The staff could not have been more helpful and the breakfast was bountiful and delicious. Highly recommend to all but especially if you have children as the rooms are large and the garden is and essential for young ones. The staff adored the children and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everyway”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend, which was wonderful... We arrived and my boyfriend had upgraded us to room 22 The Junior Venician Suite, I vow anyone to find a nicer room in the whole of venice, huge, romantic, fabulous, gorgeous view of the canal and beautiful views from the balcony. The staff are fantastic and help in anyway they could. The garden is a little oasis, we had many drinks out there! I liked the fact we were a little bit away from the tourist area, the food was better and less expensive, It also meant we walked alot more. The walk to St Marks is about 15 mins but feels a lot shorter due to the beauty of the place. Airport..take the blue bus, then water bus line 62 only 2 stops to hotel...so easy and always people around to ask if you get stuck! I just want to comment on a few things we were told about Venice before we went; It wasnt at all smelly!!!!!!!!!!! We didnt get ripped off once!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I would reccomend Venice and this Hotel to everyone. My boyfriend proposed in St Marks Square while we were there so this made the trip extra special, I will definetly return to Venice and this Hotel, cannot find anything to fault!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Model Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caplow
Reviews.Content: Although we were a bit disappointed by the relatively poor view from our room, we were immediately impressed when we realized that the hotel, one of very few we've seen in Europe, was handicapped equipped. The front desk offered to change our room for the next three nights, but we didn't want to waste time and found the room very comfortable. Everything about the hotel reflects a sincere desire to meet one's needs. We were especially impressed by Paola (sp?) at the front desk who was incredibly helpful with travel plans; we will paste her wonderful hand-drawn maps into the scrapbook for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, quiet location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BritishExpatGermany
Reviews.Content: Weekend stay in January through LastMinute, less than 100Eur/night. The location was incredibly quiet at night, even though we had a canal-facing room (free upgrade as the hotel was almost empty). The rooms are beautifully decorated, the bathrooms recently refurbished and the bed very comforatble. As the hotel was almost empty the buffet breakfast was brought to our room, after we had told them what we wanted. I would have preferred to eat downstairs and had more choice to eat what I liked the look of rather than choose blind by telephone. Nonetheless what was brought up was deliceous and they tried hard to please. The reception staff were exceptionally friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TheManor
Reviews.Content: Six of us had 3 nights in this hotel as a birthday celebration. We nearly cancelled as Venice had just had its biggest tidal floods in about 20 years. The mayor was telling tourists to stay away, but the hotel told us they were fine, and we took the risk. We arrived on the Tuesday and although the hotel had been in up to 8 inches of water in their lobby on the Monday, you just wouldn't have known. This city just knows how to deal with water! The staff were amazingly helpful and kind. They upgraded us to bigger rooms which were all wonderful. Each room is different and includes various antique furniture, which is so much better than the mass produced hotels. The area of the city is out of the heavy tourist areas but the boat bus stop is a short walk away and from there it's a very short ride to all the attractions. We were very lucky to have 2 days of sunshine and a Venice almost empty of tourists! We would certainly return and would book directly with the hotel itself next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerryb9717
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff who all spoke English. They gave us a free upgrade to our room upon our arrival. Convenient to the water bus (we took a water taxi from the airport for 95 Euros). Right on one of the canals. Area is not in the touristy areas, but a 15 minute walk from most attactions. or a quick water bus ride. beautiful rooms and very clean, good breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LancashireJames
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day trip to Venice(a 60th Birthday present from our Daughter,Son and partners) We emailed the hotel previously to find the nearest water bus stop (San Basilio) and from there it was really easy to find The Hotel is in a quiet location but well within walking distance or water bus ride to the busier parts of wonderful Venice. It was our first trip there but we would not hesitate to return. We had a lovely large room overlooking the garden which was excellent.The buffet breakfast is very good with plenty of choice and set in a lovely room(probably earlier in the season it may be served in the garden)I Venice itself is absolutely fascinating, absolutely magical and like nowhere else. We would recomend the Hotel and Venice itself to couples of all ages but probably not families. PS We found a brilliant eating place just around the corner Taverna San Trovaso (Dorso Duro 1016) which we enjoyed very much.It was constantly busy but the service was excellent and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: needs2go
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the San Basilio shuttle boat stop. We found the service excellent: The front desk and breakfast staff were always friendly and helpful. Included is breakfast (fruit, cereal, rolls, coffee, tea, juice), and free wi-fi, although the signal does not work in all the rooms, and only likes Microsoft Explorer. There is a nice semi-covered garden area in the back for quiet contemplation. The room was fairly spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was nicely tiled, with toilet, bidet and tub-shower. We also had a private deck (which had no furniture). There is a market a few blocks away-handy for snacks and personal items. There are restaurants nearby on the water, but they are pricey, and the service is poor. Better to eat at one of the many cafes or restaurants you will find while exploring. We stayed in room 26, and would recommend it Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent standard and location”
Reviews.Author: jackieplan
Reviews.Content: Sited on a quiet canalside location near the very lovely San Sebastion church. It had the benefit of access to lovely little trattoria like Bitte, charming side streets and a 10min walk to two different stops for the water bus. Paula on reception was charming and helpful without being obtrusive. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: beckpud
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before Christmas and it was the perfect hotel for us. The location is fantastic, far enough away from the main square to get a real sense of Venice and avoid all the tourists but close enough to happily walk in and back while enjoying the beautiful sites. We found a lovely restaurant for each night situated close to the hotel, particularly 'Pane, Vine e San Daniele' which had delicious food and lovely local staff. Generally food in and around the main square is of poor quality so its perfect having a hotel situated in a much more local area, generally we enjoyed our evenings near the hotel and our day around the centre. The hotel itself is fantastic, traditionally decorated, very clean and has a great ambience. The room we stayed in was large with lovely details and a huge bathroom, the best bit was the beautiful view of the canal and church below. The breakfast was good and the staff are really friendly and helpful. This hotel is a perfect base for exploring Venice if you want a slower paced less touristy location, i would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet and tranquil hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mattens
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location for getting to churches, museums and the Grand Canal. If you are not looking you will miss the hotel. No fancy signs or logs on the buildings exterior, only the street number. Once inside there is a great lobby, breakfast room and courtyard in the back of the hotel. Rooms were large for a European hotel. Neat baths and of course Murano glass lighting fixtures everywhere. Friendly service. Ask them about getting a water taxi to Murano.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shazra
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel situated in a quiet area of Venice but is only a two minute walk to the front. It's approx 10 minutes to St Marcs Square. I would definitely recomment this hotel to anyone visisting Venice. The staff are excellent in every way, helpful and very friendly. Venice is quite expensive but we found this hotel reasonable for bed and breakfast, the breakfast is continental but is ample and the variety of choice is quite good. If visiting Venice again I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: sarinni
Reviews.Content: we loved the quiet but centric location we loved the huge and quiet room we loved the big bathroom with big bath and shower we loved the breakfast in the lovely gardens only thing the air conditioning in the building was a bit too cold for me (luckyly we could control the room temperature, so it wasn't an issue)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: herbyhustonbuzz
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel, by far the best we have stayed in in Venice. Convenient but quiet location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Lovely garden, excellent for relaxing in. Our room was on the ground floor, neither garden or canal facing but it was large, beautifully furnished and with an excellent bathroom and efficient air con. The freshly sliced proscuttio ham at breakfast was a welcome bonus. The one small problem was that the hotel name is only displayed, very discreetly on the floor at the entrance and could be easily missed. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby and a very convenient supermarket 4 mins walk away. Would definitely go back.

HotelInfo.Name: San Sebastiano Garden Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Fondamenta S. Sebastiano - Dorsoduro 2542, 30123 Venice, Italy
